text: Cody Beau Walker (born June 13, 1988) is an American actor. He is the younger brother of Paul Walker, and helped complete the final scenes for his character Brian O'Conner in the film Furious 7 (2015). He made his acting debut in Abandoned Mine (2013). He went on to appear in USS Indianapolis: Men of Courage (2016) and star in the television show In the Rough. ==Early life== Cody Walker (according to Martin) was born in Los Angeles County, California to Paul William Walker III and Cheryl (née Crabtre) attended the University of California, Santa Barbara. ==Career== Walker made his acting debut in the low-budget 2013 horror film Abandoned Mine, portraying the role of Thomas; the film had mixed reviews. He appeared in Furious 7 after his brother Paul died on November 30, 2013 in a single-vehicle accident. Cody and Caleb both stepped in to help finish their brother's scenes as Brian O'Conner in the movie, which was still filming at the time of Paul's death. After his appearance in Furious 7, Cody Walker decided to pursue acting, continuing Paul's legacy as his brother's successor. He appears in the World War II film USS Indianapolis: Men of Courage (2016). Walker made his major role debut in the action-adventure series Shadow Wolves. Walker starred in the war drama film The Last Full Measure as Young Kepper. ==Personal life== Walker, who is a trained paramedic, is also the chief executive officer for his brother's charity foundation, Reach Out Worldwide, which helps emergency responders gain entry to disaster- stricken areas around the world. On August 15, 2015, Walker married longtime girlfriend Felicia Knox. Walker and his wife have one child together, who was born in December 2017. ==Filmography== ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year ! Title ! Role !
